Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TSeriesList

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<TSeries>
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TSeriesList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<TSeries>, java.util.Collection<TSeries>, java.util.List<TSeries>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class TSeriesList
extends java.util.ArrayList<TSeries>
implements java.util.List<TSeries>, java.io.Serializable
This class is used to collect series of cards, as they are generated by ISetFactory objects. Each series of card contains 6 cards having no number in common. TSeriesList objects implements TList<TSeries> interface, it is a full java List, iterable object. In addition, some specific methods and attributes have been added to manage card series specific operations, such as setting progressive labels of each card within the set, controls equal numbers between cards, etc.
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
See Also:
TCard, ISetFactory, TMakeSix, TFileFormatter, Serialized Form

    static class  TSeriesList.TLabelingModes
    List the supported choices you have to number cards when preparing their labels

    Fields inherited from class java.util.AbstractList

    modCount

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    TSeriesList​(java.lang.String name)
    Create an empty series list object, configuring a descriptive short name for this list of series.
    TSeriesList​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String labelPrefix)
    Create an empty series list object, setting the string passed in input as the prefix for the labels of each cards within this set (see prepareLabels() for further info).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(int index, TSeries e)
    Just a little specialization of the standard add method for any List objects, needed to keep trace of the creation time for the list.
    boolean add​(TSeries e)
    Just a little specialization of the standard add method for any List objects, needed to keep trace of the creation time for the list.
    void addComment​(java.lang.String comment)
    TSeriesList objects comprise a string array where users can store any free, textual comment they want to maintain together with series within the set, such as info related to the creation processes, purposes of the set, etc. Comments will be saved within the file by TFileFormatter methods.
    void compareByCard()
    Compare each possible card couple within this list, counting and setting within each series the maximum equal numbers found between them. See TSeries.compareByCard(TSeries) method for further info.
    void compareByCard​(int from, int to)
    Compare each possible card couple within a subset of this list of series, counting and setting within each series the maximum equal numbers found between them. See TSeries.compareByCard(TSeries) method for further info.
    void compareByRow()
    Compare each couple of cards of this list of series, counting and setting within each series the maximum equal numbers found between their rows.  See TSeries.compareByRow(TSeries) method for further info.
    void compareByRow​(int from, int to)
    Compare each couple of cards of a subset of this list of series, counting and setting within each series the maximum equal numbers found between their rows.  See TSeries.compareByRow(TSeries) method for further info.
    java.util.List<java.lang.String> getComments()
    Return the list of comments added to this set of series
    long getCreationElapsedMillis()
    Return the duration in milliseconds of the generation process of this list of series.
    java.time.ZonedDateTime getCreationTimeStamp()
    Return the timestamp of the completion of the generation process for this list of series.
    int getCurrentMEPC()
    Return the overall maximum amount of equal number verified between two cards belonging to this list of series. It is a value within the [0,15] range.
    int getCurrentMEPR()
    Return the overall maximum amount of equal number verified between two distinct rows belonging to two cards within this list of series. It is a value within the [0,5] range.
    java.lang.String getLabelPrefix()
    Return the prefix used to generate progressive labels for the cards within this set.
    long getMakeSixCounter()
    Return the total number of series of cards generated (and eventually discarded) by the seriesBuilder object (see TMakeSix) used to prepare this list of series. It is just an helper attribute, set by ISetFactory objects at the end of the series generation process.
    java.lang.String getMakeSixMethod()
    Return the name of the seriesBuilder method used to prepare this set of series (see TMakeSix). It is just an helper attribute, set by ISetFactory objects at the end of the series generation process.
    long getMakeSixSeed()
    Return the seed used to initialize the series builder object used to prepare this set of series (see TMakeSix). It is just an helper attribute, set by ISetFactory objects during the series generation process.
    java.lang.String getName()
    Return the descriptive name of the series list, as specified at construction time.
    java.lang.String getSetFactoryMethod()
    Return the name of the algorithm used to prepare this set of cards, trying to optimally "randomize" the numbers of the cards. It is just an helper attribute, set by ISetFactory objects during the series generation process.
    void prepareLabels()
    This batch method assign a label to each card of the series list, using default values for customization possibilities (see prepareLabels(int, int, String, TLabelingModes, boolean) for further info.
    void prepareLabels​(int start, int end, java.lang.String tagSeparator, TSeriesList.TLabelingModes mode, boolean ctrlCode)
    This batch method assign a label to each card of the specified subset of series within this series list, allowing for some customization of the method used to prepare each single label.
    void resetAllCompareResult()
    Reset the values of max equal number by cards (TSeries.getCurrentMaxEPC()) and max equal card by row (TSeries.getCurrentMaxEPR()) for each series object within this list of series.
    TSeriesListStats seriesListStatistics()
    This method checks how many cards there are within the series list having X maximum equal number by card and Y maximum equal number by row with other cards within this same list of series, providing as returned parameter a data structure containing counters for each X and Y values (X within [0,16] range, Y within [0,5] range. Pay Attention: this method requires that compareByCard() compareByRow() have been previously called on the list.
    void setLabelPrefix​(java.lang.String labelPrefix)
    Set the text (usually a short string) to be used to generate progressive labels uniquely assigned to each card within this set.
    int size()
    size() method has been overwritten in order to let it be synchronized and therefore used, by other threads, to check the generation progresses.
    void sortBestToWorstByCard()
    Sort al the series within the list putting at the beginning the series whose cards have less numbers equal to other cards (that is the lowest maxEPC series value). In this way, is for a tombola game you do not have to use all the series in the list, the probability to have concurrent win should be minimized using the series in the order they are in the list.
    void sortBestToWorstByRow()
    Sort al the series within the list putting at the beginning the series whose card rows have less numbers equal to other card rows (that is the lowest maxEPR series value). In this way, is for a tombola game you do not have to use all the series in the list, the probability to have concurrent win should be minimized using the series in the order they are in the list.

    • TSeriesList

      public TSeriesList​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String labelPrefix)
      Create an empty series list object, setting the string passed in input as the prefix for the labels of each cards within this set (see prepareLabels() for further info).
      Parameters:
      name - a short, descriptive name that can be used to identify the list of series.
      labelPrefix - the prefix to use to label cards within this set

    • addComment

      public void addComment​(java.lang.String comment)
      TSeriesList objects comprise a string array where users can store any free, textual comment they want to maintain together with series within the set, such as info related to the creation processes, purposes of the set, etc. Comments will be saved within the file by TFileFormatter methods.
      Parameters:
      comment - a comment text line you want to maintain within the series set.

    • getMakeSixCounter

      public long getMakeSixCounter()
      Return the total number of series of cards generated (and eventually discarded) by the seriesBuilder object (see TMakeSix) used to prepare this list of series. It is just an helper attribute, set by ISetFactory objects at the end of the series generation process.
      Returns:
      the overall total number of series of cards generated to prepare this list of cards.

    • getMakeSixMethod

      public java.lang.String getMakeSixMethod()

      Returns:
      the name of the seriesBuilder method used to prepare this set of series.

    • setLabelPrefix

      public void setLabelPrefix​(java.lang.String labelPrefix)
      Set the text (usually a short string) to be used to generate progressive labels uniquely assigned to each card within this set. See prepareLabels() for further info about the use of this parameter.
      Parameters:
      labelPrefix - the text prefix to use (usually a string few characters long)
      See Also:
      prepareLabels()

    • getMakeSixSeed

      public long getMakeSixSeed()

      Returns:
      the seed used to initialize the series builder object used to prepare this set of series.

    • getSetFactoryMethod

      public java.lang.String getSetFactoryMethod()
      Return the name of the algorithm used to prepare this set of cards, trying to optimally "randomize" the numbers of the cards. It is just an helper attribute, set by ISetFactory objects during the series generation process.
      Returns:
      the name of the algorithm used to prepare this set of cards.

    • size

      public int size()
      size() method has been overwritten in order to let it be synchronized and therefore used, by other threads, to check the generation progresses.

      the overall maximum amount of equal number verified between two distinct rows within this list of series.

      public void compareByCard()

      See Also:
      TSeries.compareByCard(TSeries)

    • compareByCard

      public void compareByCard​(int from, int to)
      Compare each possible card couple within a subset of this list of series, counting and setting within each series the maximum equal numbers found between them. See TSeries.compareByCard(TSeries) method for further info.
      Parameters:
      from - the index of the first series of the subset to be considered for comparisons.
      to - the index of the first series EXCLUDED by the subset to be considered for comparisons.
      See Also:
      TSeries.compareByCard(TSeries)

    • compareByRow

      public void compareByRow()
      Compare each couple of cards of this list of series, counting and setting within each series the maximum equal numbers found between their rows.  See TSeries.compareByRow(TSeries) method for further info.
      See Also:
      TSeries.compareByRow(TSeries)

    • compareByRow

      public void compareByRow​(int from, int to)
      Compare each couple of cards of a subset of this list of series, counting and setting within each series the maximum equal numbers found between their rows.  See TSeries.compareByRow(TSeries) method for further info.
      Parameters:
      from - the index of the first series of the subset to be considered for comparisons.
      to - the index of the first series EXCLUDED by the subset to be considered for comparisons.
      See Also:
      TSeries.compareByRow(TSeries)

    • resetAllCompareResult

      public void resetAllCompareResult()
      Reset the values of max equal number by cards (TSeries.getCurrentMaxEPC()) and max equal card by row (TSeries.getCurrentMaxEPR()) for each series object within this list of series.
      See Also:
      compareByCard(), compareByRow()

    • sortBestToWorstByCard

      public void sortBestToWorstByCard()
      Sort al the series within the list putting at the beginning the series whose cards have less numbers equal to other cards (that is the lowest maxEPC series value). In this way, is for a tombola game you do not have to use all the series in the list, the probability to have concurrent win should be minimized using the series in the order they are in the list.

    • sortBestToWorstByRow

      public void sortBestToWorstByRow()
      Sort al the series within the list putting at the beginning the series whose card rows have less numbers equal to other card rows (that is the lowest maxEPR series value). In this way, is for a tombola game you do not have to use all the series in the list, the probability to have concurrent win should be minimized using the series in the order they are in the list.

    • prepareLabels

      public void prepareLabels()
      This batch method assign a label to each card of the series list, using default values for customization possibilities (see prepareLabels(int, int, String, TLabelingModes, boolean) for further info.
      See Also:
      prepareLabels(int, int, String, TLabelingModes, boolean)

    • prepareLabels

      public void prepareLabels​(int start, int end, java.lang.String tagSeparator, TSeriesList.TLabelingModes mode, boolean ctrlCode) throws TTombolaRuntimeException
      This batch method assign a label to each card of the specified subset of series within this series list, allowing for some customization of the method used to prepare each single label.
      Parameters:
      start - the first series index of the subset on which apply new labels
      end - the first series index EXCLUDED by the subset on which apply new labels
      tagSeparator - a short string, typically a single character of even an empty string, used to separate different sub-components of the label (that is, the prefix, the progressive number, the checksum)
      mode - specify the mode used to number the cards, that is BYCARDS (each card is numbered independently) or BYSERIES (there is a number for each series, followed by a number for each card of the series, thus from 1 to 6).
      ctrlCode - if true a checksum is appended to the end of the label
      Throws:
      TTombolaRuntimeException - if the start or end indexes passed in input are outside the boundaries of the list

    • seriesListStatistics

      public TSeriesListStats seriesListStatistics()
      This method checks how many cards there are within the series list having X maximum equal number by card and Y maximum equal number by row with other cards within this same list of series, providing as returned parameter a data structure containing counters for each X and Y values (X within [0,16] range, Y within [0,5] range. Pay Attention: this method requires that compareByCard() compareByRow() have been previously called on the list.
      Returns:
      a data structure containing counters for each possible values of maxEPC and maxEPR values for each series of this series list.
      See Also:
      TSeries.compareByCard(TSeries), TSeries.compareByRow(TSeries), compareByCard(), compareByRow()
